name: IISWebAppManagementOnMachineGroup
description: Create or update a Website, Web App, Virtual Directories, and Application Pool
author: Microsoft Corporation

groups.name: IISBindings
groups.visibleRule: IISDeploymentType = IISWebsite && ActionIISWebsite = CreateOrUpdateWebsite && AddBinding = true

groups.name: ApplicationPoolForWebsite
groups.visibleRule: IISDeploymentType = IISWebsite && ActionIISWebsite = CreateOrUpdateWebsite && CreateOrUpdateAppPoolForWebsite = true

groups.name: IISWebsiteAuthentication
groups.visibleRule: IISDeploymentType = IISWebsite && ActionIISWebsite = CreateOrUpdateWebsite && ConfigureAuthenticationForWebsite = true

inputs.name: IISDeploymentType
inputs.label: Configuration type
inputs.helpMarkDown: You can create or update sites, applications, virtual directories, and application pools.

inputs.name: ActionIISWebsite
inputs.label: Action
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Select the appropriate action that you want to perform on an IIS website. 

"Create Or Update" will create a website or update an existing website.

 Start, Stop will start or stop the website respectively.

inputs.name: ActionIISApplicationPool
inputs.label: Action
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Select the appropriate action that you want to perform on an IIS Application Pool. 

"Create Or Update" will create app-pool or update an existing one.

Start, Stop, Recycle will start, stop or recycle the application pool respectively.

inputs.name: StartStopWebsiteName
inputs.label: Website name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the name of the IIS website.

inputs.name: WebsiteName
inputs.label: Website name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the name of the IIS website to create or update.

inputs.name: WebsitePhysicalPath
inputs.label: Physical path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the physical path where the website content will be stored. The content can reside on the local Computer, or in a remote directory, or on a network share, like C:\Fabrikam or \\\\ContentShare\Fabrikam.

inputs.name: WebsitePhysicalPathAuth
inputs.label: Physical path authentication
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the authentication mechanism that will be used to access the physical path of the website.

inputs.name: WebsiteAuthUserName
inputs.label: Username
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the user name that will be used to access the website's physical path.

inputs.name: WebsiteAuthUserPassword
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Provide the user's password that will be used to access the website's physical path.
The best practice is to create a variable in the Build or Release definition, and mark it as 'Secret' to secure it, and then use it here, like '$(userCredentials)'.
Note: Special characters in password are interpreted as per command-line arguments

inputs.name: AddBinding
inputs.label: Add binding
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the option to add port binding for the website.

inputs.name: Bindings
inputs.label: Add bindings
inputs.helpMarkDown: Click on the extension [...] button to add bindings for the website.

inputs.name: CreateOrUpdateAppPoolForWebsite
inputs.label: Create or update app pool
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the option to create or update an application pool. If checked, the website will be created in the specified app pool.

inputs.name: ConfigureAuthenticationForWebsite
inputs.label: Configure authentication
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the option to configure authentication for website.

inputs.name: AppPoolNameForWebsite
inputs.label: Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the name of the IIS application pool to create or update.

inputs.name: DotNetVersionForWebsite
inputs.label: .NET version
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Select the version of the .NET Framework that is loaded by the application pool.
If the applications assigned to this application pool do not contain managed code, then select the 'No Managed Code' option from the list.

inputs.name: PipeLineModeForWebsite
inputs.label: Managed pipeline mode
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the managed pipeline mode that specifies how IIS processes requests for managed content. Use classic mode only when the applications in the application pool cannot run in the Integrated mode.

inputs.name: AppPoolIdentityForWebsite
inputs.label: Identity
inputs.helpMarkDown: Configure the account under which an application pool's worker process runs. Select one of the predefined security accounts or configure a custom account.

inputs.name: AppPoolUsernameForWebsite
inputs.label: Username
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the username of the custom account that you want to use.

inputs.name: AppPoolPasswordForWebsite
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Provide the password for custom account.
The best practice is to create a variable in the Build or Release definition, and mark it as 'Secret' to secure it, and then use it here, like '$(userCredentials)'.
Note: Special characters in password are interpreted as per command-line arguments

inputs.name: AnonymousAuthenticationForWebsite
inputs.label: Anonymous authentication
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the option to enable anonymous authentication for website.

inputs.name: BasicAuthenticationForWebsite
inputs.label: Basic authentication
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the option to enable basic authentication for website.

inputs.name: WindowsAuthenticationForWebsite
inputs.label: Windows authentication
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the option to enable windows authentication for website.

inputs.name: ParentWebsiteNameForVD
inputs.label: Parent website name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the name of the parent Website of the virtual directory.

inputs.name: VirtualPathForVD
inputs.label: Virtual path
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Provide the virtual path of the virtual directory. 

Example: To create a virtual directory Site/Application/VDir enter /Application/Vdir. The parent website and application should be already existing.

inputs.name: PhysicalPathForVD
inputs.label: Physical path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the physical path where the virtual directory's content will be stored. The content can reside on the local Computer, or in a remote directory, or on a network share, like C:\Fabrikam or \\\\ContentShare\Fabrikam.

inputs.name: VDPhysicalPathAuth
inputs.label: Physical path authentication
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the authentication mechanism that will be used to access the physical path of the virtual directory.

inputs.name: VDAuthUserName
inputs.label: Username
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the user name that will be used to access the virtual directory's physical path.

inputs.name: VDAuthUserPassword
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Provide the user's password that will be used to access the virtual directory's physical path.
The best practice is to create a variable in the Build or Release definition, and mark it as 'Secret' to secure it, and then use it here, like '$(userCredentials)'.
Note: Special characters in password are interpreted as per command-line arguments

inputs.name: ParentWebsiteNameForApplication
inputs.label: Parent website name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the name of the parent Website under which the application will be created or updated.

inputs.name: VirtualPathForApplication
inputs.label: Virtual path
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Provide the virtual path of the application. 

Example: To create an application Site/Application enter /Application. The parent website should be already existing.

inputs.name: PhysicalPathForApplication
inputs.label: Physical path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the physical path where the application's content will be stored. The content can reside on the local Computer, or in a remote directory, or on a network share, like C:\Fabrikam or \\\\ContentShare\Fabrikam.

inputs.name: ApplicationPhysicalPathAuth

inputs.name: ApplicationAuthUserName

inputs.name: StartStopRecycleAppPoolName
inputs.label: Application pool name
inputs.visibleRule: ActionIISApplicationPool = StartAppPool || ActionIISApplicationPool = StopAppPool || ActionIISApplicationPool = RecycleAppPool
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the name of the IIS application pool.

inputs.name: AppCmdCommands
inputs.label: Additional appcmd.exe commands
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Enter additional AppCmd.exe commands. For more than one command use a line separator, like
list apppools
list sites
recycle apppool /apppool.name:ExampleAppPoolName
